sub_topic: Prove that every group of prime order is cyclic.
message_1: How many generators does a group of prime order have?
message_2: A group of prime order p has p-1 generators. This is because a group of prime order is cyclic, and in a cyclic group of order n, there are exactly φ(n) generators, where φ is the Euler's totient function. Since p is prime, φ(p) = p-1.
